title: Allies of jailed Russian opposition leader Navalny say he has gone missing
description: The whereabouts of Alexei Navalny were unknown on Monday as his spokesperson revealed that officials at the penal colony stated he was no longer listed in the inmate roster when one of his lawyers inquired about his whereabouts.

title: Zelensky warns US Congress that delay in military aid is fulfilling Putin's 'dreams'
description: The Ukrainian leader in a speech in Washington on Monday issued a plea to Republicans in Congress to break its deadlock and approve continued support for Kyiv. He is set to meet with President Joe Biden and congressional leaders from both parties on Tuesday.

title: Poland: Donald Tusk appointed prime minister
description: The Polish parliament on Monday appointed the centrist leader to form the next government, paving the way for a new pro-European Union administration following eight years of turbulent national conservative rule.

title: 'The Argentine society of the early 20th century hailed by Javier Milei was far from idyllic'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, historian Ezequiel Adamovsky counters the claims of Argentina's new president, arguing that the liberal policies put in place by the 1976 dictatorship are to blame for the country's plunge into poverty.

title: French MPs reject Macron's immigration bill without debating it
description: The rejection of the controversial bill is a major blow for Macron's government. Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin offered to resign but the president refused to accept his resignation.

title: 'The end of the line': The French repatriation center helping migrants who choose to go home
description: People volunteering to leave France will spend their last days in the country at a new center opened in September near Toulouse, where they receive administrative and financial support.

title: French lower house rejects Macron's immigration bill
description: The rejection of the controversial bill is a blow for Macron's centrist government, and has fuelled speculation that it could opt to trigger the extremely unpopular article 49.3 of the constitution, which allows it to pass legislation without a vote

title: Critics pan 'unacceptable' draft text as COP28 comes to an end
description: The UN climate conference's deal has been criticized for ignoring calls to phase out fossil fuels, with activists fearing objections from fossil fuel-producing countries have had an impact.

title: Russia's repression machine goes into overdrive
description: Condemned to heavy sentences, ordinary citizens opposed to the war in Ukraine are joining the list of political prisoners by the dozens.

title: Polish parliament rejects proposed right-wing government
description: The national conservatives who have ruled Poland for eight years are expected to finally relinquish power this week to a centrist bloc led by political veteran Donald Tusk.

title: The lost Gaza of a young Palestinian refugee in France
description: 'Nacera' – who is French-Palestinian – was exfiltrated from Gaza at the beginning of November with her parents, and now watches helplessly as the city where she was born and grew up is destroyed.

title: French government faces major test as immigration bill arrives on the floor of the Assemblée Nationale
description: As the government has lost its majority after the 2022 legislative elections, Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin is not guaranteed to have the votes to pass his text.

title: Golden Globes: Barbenheimer tops 2024 nominations
description: 'Barbie' and 'Oppenheimer' topped the newly revamped Golden Globes film nominations Monday, with Greta Gerwig's feminist satire receiving nine nominations, and Christopher Nolan's drama eight.

title: Elon Musk reinstates far-right conspiracy theorist Alex Jones on X
description: Following a poll Musk conducted on X, the billionaire owner of the social media platform went back on his decision not to let the far-right conspiracy theorist back on ex-Twitter.

title: New Tintin edition addresses racism controversy
description: The new edition of 'Tintin in the Congo' contains a preface explaining the colonial context of the time it was released, in 1931. It had become increasingly criticized for the way it portrayed Africans.

title: Reborn night train links Berlin and Paris
description: The overnight connection returns nine years after the previous service was shut down. It is set to run daily from October 2024.

title: Science Po director suggests his temporary suspension after arrest for domestic violence
description: Around 100 students staged a sit-in to call for Mathias Vicherat's resignation. Him and his wife were arrested on December 3 after accusations of domestic violence.

title: Olympic surfing to be held in Teahupo'o after solution found to row, Polynesia president says
description: Moetai Brotherson said an agreement had been found with environmental organizations to allow the contest to be held at the famous wave.

title: 'Leave the World Behind' review: Survival of the fittest
description: Sam Esmail's film, streaming on Netflix, stars Julia Roberts and Ethan Hawke. Their characters plunge into an end-of-the-world scenario after a cyberattack.

title: Russia to hold presidential vote in occupied Ukraine
description: Moscow said that it would be holding Russian presidential elections in Ukrainian regions Russia claimed to have annexed.

title: 'Danny the Red' breaks with Macron and calls on the left to unite for the European Elections
description: Daniel Cohn-Bendit, who had supported Macron since 2017, is now criticizing the French president for having given up on a balanced stance to place 'the center-right in power.'

title: Israel justifies arrests of Palestinians after images showing stripped men detained in Gaza
description: Israel responded to the fierce criticism provoked by degrading photographs and videos showing dozens of naked men, some of them blindfolded, captured by the Israeli army on December 7.

title: Javier Milei warns of painful austerity measures as he takes office in Argentina
description: The country's new president was sworn in on Sunday. In his inaugural address, he warned of a painful period of unemployment, economic stagnation and inflation.

title: COP28: China proves a key player in possible fossil fuel phase-out
description: During the negotiations, China's climate envoy did not rule out the idea of a gradual phase-out of fossil fuels.

title: Doctors in one Paris suburb fear a potential health crisis if State Medical Aid gets abolished
description: As the Assemblée Nationale will start debating an immigration bill on Monday, this public hospital is among those most exposed to the consequences of a potential reform of this healthcare coverage.

title: India's supreme court upholds Kashmir autonomy revocation
description: The court ruled to uphold a 2019 decision to revoke the limited autonomy which had been in force since the 1950's in the Muslim-majority state, where an insurgency has raged for decades. India's President Modi welcomed the decision as a 'beacon of hope.'

title: Philippines summons Chinese diplomats over clashes at sea
description: China's envoy and ambassador have been summoned by the Philippines, with expelling them 'seriously considered', after several confrontations between Chinese and Philippine boats over the weekend in the disputed South China Sea.

title: Serbian elections set to challenge or confirm president's hold on power
description: On Sunday, December 17, Serbians will head to the polls, in local and parliamentary elections which will serve as a referendum on President Aleksandar Vucic's government, which has been challenged by shootings, protests and tensions with Kosovo.

title: COP climate talks focus on fossil fuel deal
description: Climate campaigners and negotiators say the world has never been this close to a deal on winding down oil, gas and coal.

title: Hyperinflation wave recedes in Europe, leaving household budgets in tatters
description: Eurozone inflation has finally dropped to 2.4% in November. However, its effects over the last two years have slashed living standards, in an unprecedented decline since the 1970s, leading to major changes in consumer habits.

title: Trump says he won't testify in New York fraud trial
description: In a statement, the former president said he has 'nothing more to say'.

title: Slovaki's Robert Fico is taking control of justice since his return to power
description: Slovakia's new prime minister, who has been hit with corruption investigations, has launched wide-ranging purges among magistrates and police officers.

title: Who are the Yemeni Houthis involved in the war between Hamas and Israel?
description: After firing drones and missiles, and capturing a ship belonging to an Israeli businessman, Houthi rebels have attacked two ships in the Red Sea. These actions illustrate their ability to cause harm, but above all their regional ambitions.

title: Penpa Tsering, chairman of the Tibetan government-in-exile: 'The West fed the Chinese dragon'
description: Visiting Paris, the most senior representative of the 130,000 Tibetans in the diaspora confirms that there are still 'channels of communication' with Beijing but deplores the fact that 'there is no dialogue at all.'
